title: CASE FILE 001 — LATE SHIFT
systemNote: NOTE: The system provides fragments. You provide judgment.
caseHeader: CASE FILE 001 · STATUS: ACTIVE\nPROBABILITY OF VIOLENT OUTCOME: 71% (volatile)
briefing:
Subject: Marisol Vega.
Night-shift ER intake at Easton Medical Center.
Routine deviation detected at 23:47.
Three things matter: what changed, who caused it, and how quickly it escalates.

dossier.name: Marisol Vega
dossier.summary:
A night-shift ER intake nurse at Easton Medical Center.

The system flagged her because her routine stopped being routine.
You will learn who she is the way you learn most things: in fragments.
dossier.contacts: One frequent contact labeled “R”. Abruptly ceased today.
dossier.behavior: Preparation indicators present. External pressure likely.

openingFeed.text: If you’re reading this, you’ve already crossed a line you can’t uncross.\nI’m sorry for that.

Hi.
You’re earlier than I predicted. That’s interesting.

Don’t worry.
You’re safe. Mostly.
Whoever you are, you owe me a donut explanation when this is over.

feed.text: Deviation confirmed across multiple signals.\nConfidence increasing.
Something is missing from the picture. Missing is never accidental.
If she’s in trouble, it’s not because she’s stupid. It’s because she trusted someone.
Intervention window opened.\nSmall actions. Precise timing.
Do the least you can.\nBut do it.

leads.title: Shift Timeline
leads.resultText: Shift started 19:00. Normal intake volume.\nAt 23:47: routine deviation detected — repeated badge movement, device silence, and a single cash withdrawal.

reaction.text: Start with what changed. Everything else is noise.

leads.title: Badge Access Logs
leads.resultText:
Badge scan: 19:02 — Staff entrance
Badge scan: 23:11 — East stairwell
Badge scan: 23:41 — Parking garage access
No recorded exit.

reaction.text: People don’t forget to badge out. Not like that.

leads.title: Purchases / ATM
leads.resultText: ATM withdrawal: $180 at 21:09\nPurchase: bottled water, bandages, prepaid phone\nNo further transactions.

leads.title: Phone Metadata
leads.resultText:
Device active until 23:46.
GPS stationary near parking structure.
Signal interruption: 26 minutes.
Reconnected at 00:13 from a moving location.

reaction.text: Silence is a hand over a mouth. Or a hand over a signal.

leads.title: Known Contacts
leads.resultText:
Frequent contact: saved as “R”
Contact abruptly ceased today at 18:22
Draft message (unsent):
“I told you I can’t keep doing this.”

reaction.text: That’s the sentence right before things go bad.

leads.title: Recent Searches
leads.resultText:
Recent searches include:
• “restraining order process”
• “prepaid phone no contract”
• “parking garage cameras hospital”
• “how long does a protection order take”
leads.clueSummary: She suspects danger and is preparing an exit plan.

reaction.text: She knew. People always know first.

leads.title: Garage Camera Pull
leads.resultText:
Garage camera 23:44 shows a second figure near the stairwell.
Face obscured.
Subject posture defensive.
Interaction ends abruptly. Both exit frame fast.

leads.title: Vehicle Ping
leads.resultText: Vehicle telemetry indicates movement from Easton garage toward Route 19.\nTwo stops consistent with being followed: short idle, then hard acceleration.

endings.good: Security intercepted a confrontation in progress. The second figure fled.\nMarisol left with coworkers.\nShe will never know why tonight went differently.
endings.neutral: Security conducted a sweep after she already left.\nNo contact was made.\nOutcome unknown.
endings.bad: Security arrived late.\nThe confrontation happened off-camera.\nMarisol survived — but the cost was not small.

endings.good: Message delivered.\nMarisol delayed her exit and left with staff.\nThe garage remained empty when the second figure returned.
endings.neutral: Message delivered. She hesitated, then left anyway.\nNo incident recorded on-site.
endings.bad: Message arrived too late.\nShe read it after the encounter had already started.

endings.good: An officer happened to be nearby and responded immediately.\nIt was luck.\nLuck counts.
endings.neutral: Report entered the queue.\nNo immediate response.\nThe moment passed.
endings.bad: Noise without timing.\nThe response came after the damage.

epilogueFeed.text: Next time you drag me into this, I’m picking the donut place.
